result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane M Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances unless specifically prescribed to him and taken in the manner prescribed, or drug paraphernalia.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit to random UA testing.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Court does not grant any sentence credit.

Defendant Shane M Miller in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel.  Defendant Shane M Miller in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
COVERS 14CF172 AND 14CF204.  No corrections to PSI.  Argument by State.  Argument by Attorney Hoel.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 5 years Probation concurrent with other sentences
No jail credit
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
